text:
So I believe the js_render_options only apply to the module.js of the module, rather than the included assets, unless it applies it to all, maybe you’ll have to test that

If it does only apply to the module js, you could always add it as a requires_js tag in the html+hubl section of the module
Also you might actually find if you’re using defer (or asyc) it’s better to position it in the head, as it allows the js to load in parallel to the html loading

This site is a really good tool,
The page on async and defer has some nice graphs explaining it all
<https://pagespeedchecklist.com/async-and-defer>

By adding the js to the footer it won’t start downloading until the dom content is pretty much all loaded
